inlineContent.text: In this guide, we’ll explore the process of developing tweaks using simple sample code, making it accessible even for beginners. There are two primary methods for tweak development, and this document will focus on JavaScript-based development in version 3.0.
To kickstart your development journey, follow these steps:
Create a new project folder to initiate your development process.
Inside your project folder, create a file named “main.js.”
Now, let’s delve into the key functions you’ll be working with in your JavaScript development:
The apply function is triggered when the tile is in its default black state, and the user taps the tile. This function returns a boolean value, but the value is not typically used.
The restore function is called when the tile is in its default white state, and the user taps the tile. Similar to the apply function, it returns a boolean value that is often unused.

The state function serves to visually communicate to both the user and the system whether the apply or restore function was executed successfully, based on the color of the tile. Consequently, it returns a boolean value.

The update function acts like a daemon, called periodically. It’s triggered when the adjustment switch is turned on immediately after Misaka starts or when the user turns on the adjustment switch from an off state. This function returns the number of seconds until the next call as an integer.
The settings function is invoked just before the settings screen is opened, enabling you to create dynamic settings screens for your tweak.
This guide provides you with a foundational understanding of XXXXX development with JavaScript. For more detailed information, please refer to the table of contents.

abstract.text: XXXXX has evolved significantly to support tweak development using JavaScript.

doc://Documentation/tutorials/TableOfCon.title: 初めてのDocCでチュートリアル作成

abstract.text: DocCでチュートリアルを作成する方法を紹介します。
